snippet: Henry Lee McCollum, 50, was released a day after a North Carolina judge threw out his conviction in a 1983 rape and murder. Mentally disabled, he must now learn to live in a world he has not experienced since he was a teenager.
abstract: Henry Lee McCollum, released from death row one day after North Carolina judge threw out his 1983 conviction for rape and murder, faces uncertain future; McCollumn is mentally disabled, and must learn to live in a world that he has not experienced since he was a teenager.
lead_paragraph: Henry Lee McCollum, 50, was released a day after a North Carolina judge threw out his conviction in a 1983 rape and murder. Mentally disabled, he must now learn to live in a world he has not experienced since he was a teenager.

headline.main: North Carolina Men Are Released After Convictions Are Overturned
headline.print_headline: From Death Row to Unfamiliar World
